snippet: Anthony Weiner is now in the upper tier of mayoral candidates, and Eliot Spitzer appears to be counting on the same phenomenon to help him in the race for comptroller.
abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column examines puzzling combination of celebrity and machismo that has kept both Anthony D Weiner and Eliot Spitzer in their respective races for mayor and comptroller of New York City; observes that quiet and sensible campaign season has turned into curiosity and the equivalent of a motorcycle hurtling at full throttle down the Bronx River Parkway.
lead_paragraph: Anthony Weiner is now in the upper tier of mayoral candidates, and Eliot Spitzer appears to be counting on the same phenomenon to help him in the race for comptroller.

headline.print_headline: Relying on Celebrity and Machismo to Upend a Political Season
headline.main: Relying on Celebrity and Machismo to Upend a Political Season
